soso.string.4287: However... it is not too late yet... as long as we hold the ritual we can dispel the curse of undeath.
soso.string.4288: Wipe away everything they have accumulated and leave the night raid to you...
soso.string.4289: The stationed camp has only just been set up; it’s a mixed crowd, with teams often being shifted back and forth with Seimen.
soso.string.4290: Presumably they haven’t yet established a sound management system; go strike the personnel of the stationed legion.
soso.string.4291: Then strip off their uniforms and wear them yourself, disguising yourself as one of them.
soso.string.4292: Then get your hands on the map.
soso.string.4294: Do you have something you want to say？
soso.string.4295: ...I was negligent; I should have realized that in the Empire’s heartland...
soso.string.4296: the appearance of an undead formed from a demonfolk’s remains is exceedingly abnormal...
soso.string.4297: Nor had I considered why, though the Pope’s remains were found in the Holy Capital ─ Woden...
soso.string.4298: we never found the remains of the Demon King who fell at that final battleground...
soso.string.4299: It never occurred to me that the demonfolk undead in Hafos Village would be the Demon King’s remains...
soso.string.4300: I should have had you deliver a fatal blow with a Green‑Soul weapon the moment you returned.
soso.string.4301: Thinking about it now won’t help... the Demon King is an abnormal existence, a walking calamity...
soso.string.4302: Such a powerful individual could survive even after the curse ritual; leaving behind any medium of contamination would be our defeat.
soso.string.4303: You did well to discover his presence before the ritual.
soso.string.4304: Search quickly! The thief shouldn’t have gotten far yet!
soso.string.4305: ...I’ll go prepare the supplies needed to head for the Forest of Lost Paths.
soso.string.4306: We have to infiltrate once more.
soso.string.4307: This time we must eliminate the obstacle to the ritual... the Demon King’s undead, before it fully revives!
soso.string.4308: No... your outfit doesn’t look like a member of the stationed legion; like this you can’t infiltrate deeply...
soso.string.4309: Now that’s good! However you look, you’re a member of the stationed legion!
soso.string.4310: From here on it’s up to you to find where the map is...
soso.string.4311: So long as we hold and complete the ritual at the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar, the victory is ours...
soso.string.4312: Looks like it succeeded... the Demon King was struck down, right？
soso.string.4313: ...That’s a relief; though I don’t know how much the revived undead Demon King recovered, it must have been a hard fight...
soso.string.4314: I’ve deciphered the map of the Forest of Lost Paths... this forest is twisted by the Sacred Tree’s suffusing mana...
soso.string.4315: The immense power causes space to expand; the Forest of Lost Paths... is not as narrow as it appears to the eye...
soso.string.4316: Rather, it’s a vast place like another dimension.
soso.string.4317: Once lost you cannot escape... I’ve recorded the key points of the map... follow the guidance!
soso.string.4318: Ugh... you’re here—this is the deepest part of the Forest of Lost Paths...
soso.string.4319: Behind this massive gate lies the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar...
soso.string.4320: Besides you I’ve found another person to help us...
soso.string.4321: Oh... long time no see; thank you for taking care of our village...
soso.string.4322: Though it’s a pity we didn’t retake the village, today all hardships will end...
soso.string.4323: Kadon... a Holy‑Tree Church priest of Hafos Village destroyed by the Lord of Seimen’s schemes...
soso.string.4327: Today all our wishes will be fulfilled...
soso.string.4328: Step back a little... I’m going to open the gate...
soso.string.4329: Something’s odd with the gate unlock...
soso.string.4330: No... the unlocking itself succeeded... sounds a bit like a fairy tale......
soso.string.4331: According to the records, the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar is an altar that enshrines and gathers Holy‑Spirits...
soso.string.4332: When the altar gate is unlocked, the Holy‑Spirits will open the gate as a welcome.
soso.string.4333: The gate is still firmly shut...
soso.string.4335: Is it related to those people around us...？
soso.string.4336: Those are drifters... the final fate of those who entered the Forest of Lost Paths without a map...
soso.string.4337: If you don’t follow the correct road, once you enter you absolutely can’t get out...
soso.string.4338: Chaotic time and misaligned space—by no means speak to them...
soso.string.4339: If drawn into their time‑space, you will never return...
soso.string.4340: Isn’t that so... but regardless... we must go forward.
soso.string.4341: Mm... to resolve this aberration, no matter what, we have to advance...
soso.string.4344: The follow‑up pursuit mission can no longer continue...
soso.string.4345: We were just a little short....
soso.string.4346: In this battle our army has already lost over seventy percent of its strength...
soso.string.4347: We no longer have the power to continue the pursuit...
soso.string.4348: And since we’ve retaken the mithril mine, the benefits of pressing deep are too few...
soso.string.4349: We must not give up here.
soso.string.4350: Reig is still discussing support... but it looks difficult.
soso.string.4351: To buy time we have to head to the Forest of Lost Paths as soon as possible...
soso.string.4352: Even after felling Biao Su, the curse is still spreading...
soso.string.4353: And... the curse’s embodied form—that great dragon—hasn’t been brought down yet.
soso.string.4354: My attacks only drove it back.
soso.string.4355: Striking now gives us the greatest chance of success...
soso.string.4357: You don’t plan to stop here, do you
soso.string.4358: Of course... we will head again to the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar and this time wipe out the curse.
soso.string.4359: That’s what you say... but didn’t you already fail？
soso.string.4360: That was ignorance of the enemy—we were caught off guard by interference!
soso.string.4361: Now that we know there’s an obstacle, we won’t be careless...
soso.string.4362: You’ve thought of some methods too, haven’t you...? Otherwise why prepare the core again？
soso.string.4363: ...Because there’s no other choice, we can only try once more？
soso.string.4365: It’s fine—thanks to your preparations we can set out for the Forest of Lost Paths at once.
soso.string.4367: We absolutely will not fail this time!
soso.string.4368: This time we will absolutely succeed!
soso.string.4370: But... is it really because there is no other way that we are repeating the same method again？
soso.string.4372: Lord Yuanchuan, please wait a moment.
soso.string.4373: Wait？ Still waiting...? Where’s Shunchang？ Why isn’t he here yet!
soso.string.4374: I’m not going to mind your situation; I only care whether your plan goes smoothly!
soso.string.4375: Th‑the plan... isn’t going very smoothly... but...
soso.string.4376: So it failed after all! I told you Shunchang isn’t a match for Lanwang. You just wouldn’t listen!
soso.string.4378: No buts! Since you failed, we’ll proceed according to our plan!
soso.string.4379: We demonfolk will attack Seimen in two days without regard for anything!
soso.string.4381: Looks like a bug crawled in. Kill him—don’t make me do it myself.
soso.string.4383: We’ve been discovered! We have to hurry and run back!
soso.string.4384: Yo! The newbie that guy recommended？
soso.string.4385: Kid, you look pretty sturdy! Your name is....
soso.string.4386: Looking at your gear... looks like you seem to be....
soso.string.4390: You’ve come at just the right time!
soso.string.4391: Because monsters suddenly surged out of the “Root‑Burrow Deep Cavern” next door, and they’re giving us trouble.
soso.string.4392: As your entry test as a newcomer—just perfect...!
soso.string.4394: I’m sure that’s no problem for a seasoned merc like you! 【Quest Book has been updated】
soso.string.4395: Don’t know where the “Root‑Burrow Deep Cavern” is？ The Quest Book will give you guidance.
soso.string.4396: “Mine Wraith‑Corpses” are weak, so don’t worry too much.
soso.string.4397: Come back to me after you defeat the “Mine Wraith‑Corpses”.
soso.string.4398: Oh! Looks like you’ve completed the quest—seeing the scars piled up on your weapon, just as expected...
soso.string.4399: A seasoned adventurer indeed! The Security Corps of the Town Under the Tree ─ Sno welcomes you!
soso.string.4400: These are the Security Corps uniforms and standard gear...
soso.string.4401: Perhaps you have better, more familiar gear—don’t worry! Just use it directly!
soso.string.4402: Wearing unsuitable gear only makes battle dangerous!
soso.string.4403: ...By the way, did you get any strange materials from those monsters？
soso.string.4404: These materials are fine goods that can only be obtained near our Sno.
soso.string.4405: All thanks to the Sacred Tree’s blessing, we can collect these mana‑charged materials here!
soso.string.4406: By using these materials at our special Forging Station, you can craft even stronger gear!
soso.string.4407: This is the Recipe Book for the Forging Station; take a look!
soso.string.4408: As long as you gather the materials, you can forge good gear!
soso.string.4409: Yes... as long as you gather the materials!
soso.string.4410: But those damned monsters snatched the materials right from under our noses!
soso.string.4411: Our “Root‑Burrow Deep Cavern” was invaded by them and had to be sealed!
soso.string.4412: Don’t worry! The sealing won’t last long...
soso.string.4413: We’ve already prepared a Purification Unit to reclaim the cavern.
soso.string.4414: Ah! Take these materials to Rock‑Gallop at the Church.
soso.string.4415: (You put the supplies into your pocket.)
soso.string.4416: Once he completes the final potion supplies, we can launch the “Root‑Burrow Deep Cavern” purification plan!
soso.string.4418: Didn’t expect you to still be alive. No wonder you’re the one he recommended.
soso.string.4419: We lost quite a few people in this failed operation.
soso.string.4420: The next purification plan will likely be pushed back a lot.
soso.string.4421: Sorry about this for a newcomer like you.
soso.string.4422: But we really don’t have the spare capacity to look after you right now.
soso.string.4423: Patrolling the streets, subjugating harmful beasts, guarding against the corpses in the “Root‑Burrow Deep Cavern”.
soso.string.4424: Even whether the Security Corps can keep running is in question.
soso.string.4425: Once things stabilize we’ll properly hold your induction party.
soso.string.4426: During this period, go back to the dorm and make use of these Training Tokens.
soso.string.4427: Take them and train on your own; true strength will never betray you.
soso.string.4428: May the Sacred Tree’s blessing be with you.
soso.string.4429: 【In the Book of Adventure, click “Set Traits” and it will guide you in using Training Tokens.】
soso.string.4430: 【Outpost unlocked. Through Main Story Guidance you can head to the Security Dorm you can freely build.】
soso.string.4431: Sorry it’s taken so many days.
soso.string.4432: Though we haven’t really trained you yet, you know what happened last night, right？
soso.string.4433: Hafos Village fell; a large number of refugees poured in to us.
soso.string.4434: I hear it was overrun by undead crawling out of the graveyard in droves.
soso.string.4435: Seriously... trouble at a time like this...
soso.string.4436: Those priests, honestly... if they’d kept up proper purification, would this have happened!
soso.string.4437: Every single one of them is like that!
soso.string.4438: Sorry, I got carried away. Back to business—go find the Holy‑Tree Church priest of Hafos Village, Kadon.
soso.string.4439: I hear he came along with the refugees and ended up in a room at the inn.
soso.string.4440: Find out clearly what exactly happened in Hafos Village!
soso.string.4441: Demons...? That’s a pretty questionable claim.
soso.string.4442: The war between humans and the demonfolk ended decades ago.
soso.string.4443: We also have the border Fortress City ─ Seimen keeping constant watch on demon activity.
soso.string.4444: We can’t just leave it be... that won’t do either.
soso.string.4445: Although the failure of the purification plan dealt a fatal blow to the Security Corps.
soso.string.4446: For the village’s safety we at least have to confirm the undead’s movements.
soso.string.4447: Earlier I already sent the warrior Duanxian to Hafos Village to monitor the undead.
soso.string.4448: Meet up with him and bring the intel back. Oh, right...
soso.string.4449: Before you go, you can stop by the first‑floor office to accept tasks issued to adventurers.
soso.string.4450: From them you can obtain Training Tokens and a bit of money.
soso.string.4451: It’s fine if you don’t finish within the time; it just counts as a failed quest.
soso.string.4452: Is that so—so that’s what Duanxian said.
soso.string.4453: According to the records, the demonfolk are an exceedingly powerful race.
soso.string.4454: They are strong physically, and their magic is first‑rate as well.
soso.string.4455: Though there are individual differences, even the weakest requires five seasoned warriors to possibly subjugate.
soso.string.4456: But we don’t have that many people...
soso.string.4458: I’ll assign four people to reduce the number of monsters as much as possible.
soso.string.4459: You, I, and Duanxian will join up to slay the demon.
soso.string.4460: I know it’s reckless, but we have to do it. Can we？
soso.string.4461: I knew I wasn’t mistaken—let’s fight together!
soso.string.4462: Sigh... no—we can’t beat it at all.
soso.string.4463: Then what on earth is going on？
soso.string.4464: So... the monster threats in Hafos Village and the Root‑Burrow Deep Cavern are steadily increasing; if this goes on... we may have to... consider abandoning the village.
soso.string.4466: You ask why we don’t talk with Rock‑Gallop about the source of the demonfolk’s mysterious power？
soso.string.4467: Hmph, did you forget？ The Root‑Burrow Deep Cavern purification failed thanks to those Holy‑Tree Church priests.
soso.string.4468: Our Security Corps carved a path with blood and flesh to lead the priests to the deepest part.
soso.string.4469: But he repaid us by using a failed ritual.
soso.string.4470: So many of my comrades... my brothers‑in‑arms... were lost like that.
soso.string.4471: And he doesn’t even know the reason the ritual failed.
soso.string.4472: Let’s go! If you want to ask, go ask him. I’m very disappointed in Rock‑Gallop.
soso.string.4473: If a person doesn’t dare reflect on himself, how could he ever earn others’ respect？.
soso.string.4475: Everyone in the town is grateful to you!
soso.string.4476: All right, I’m sorry I couldn’t trust Rock‑Gallop.
soso.string.4477: Thanks to you two we managed to fell a demon we thought impossible to fell.
soso.string.4478: Life is still tough, but this situation is at least bearable.
soso.string.4479: What should I give you as a reward？ Oh—how about this？
soso.string.4481: This is my favorite short sword; in Sno, whoever carries it is my agent.
soso.string.4482: You’re the town’s hero! Wear it so everyone knows I’ve got your back!
soso.string.4483: Celebrate! Though there’s lots to do tomorrow, at least today let’s forget everything and relax. Cheers!
soso.string.4484: Good timing, brother. I called you today to ask a favor.
soso.string.4485: A lot has happened in the village lately.
soso.string.4486: Being short‑handed is quite a serious problem.
soso.string.4487: So we’ve decided to seek support from the lord.
soso.string.4488: The mithril mine here is an important source of ore for the nation.
soso.string.4489: There is no garrison because it’s far from the border and no highly aggressive monsters dwell here.
soso.string.4490: But now it’s different; even though you felled that terrifying demonfolk in Hafos Village.
soso.string.4491: we’re still at a total loss regarding the surging undead problem.
soso.string.4492: Relying only on hired adventurers and the Security Corps’ regular subjugations—the pressure is enormous; one slip and it all collapses.
soso.string.4493: Although the village must shoulder the payroll burden brought by a garrison, in the long run that hurts development.
soso.string.4494: But we have no choice now, right？
soso.string.4495: Now to the point: this is a handwritten letter from the village chief.
soso.string.4496: We need someone to deliver it to the lord.
soso.string.4497: The road passes through the Mengteng Mountain Range, and word from caravans says....
soso.string.4498: recent bandit problems have been severe; several caravans already refuse to go.
soso.string.4499: Although things are stable for the moment, we can’t guarantee the future will be the same.
soso.string.4500: This letter needs a reliable person to quickly deliver it to the lord.
soso.string.4502: I knew you would be willing to help.
soso.string.4503: Also… take these as your travel expenses.
soso.string.4505: Before setting out on your journey, you should greet the people you know, right?
soso.string.4506: I wish you a safe journey as well.
soso.string.4507: Don’t know where the ‘Church of the Holy Tree’ is? The quest log will guide you.
soso.string.4508: Hurry up! The Purification Squad is waiting for your potions.
soso.string.4509: The subjugation force is bound to win, and as the promising newcomer, of course you’ll be joining too!
soso.string.4510: Brother, it’s worth celebrating that you returned safely.
soso.string.4511: But the situation is rather severe—ever since you departed…
soso.string.4512: A new undead nest has appeared near the southern village of Harves.
soso.string.4513: Under the protection of the Holy Tree, undead have never appeared here before…
soso.string.4514: Why are they now appearing in such great numbers…?
soso.string.4516: The strike force couldn’t even push into the nest’s interior,
soso.string.4517: They’re clad in fine mithril gear, and even taking down one is extremely difficult.
soso.string.4518: And they keep coming endlessly—defeat one, and another appears.
soso.string.4519: With our strength, we can’t resolve this…
soso.string.4520: So we’ve left the defense work to the reinforcements from Seimen.
soso.string.4521: But that would make Snow nothing more than meat on the chopping block.
soso.string.4522: I need you to take out ten zombies wearing mithril gear.
soso.string.4523: Prove that Snow has enough self-defense capability.
soso.string.4524: I’m counting on you for this, brother.
soso.string.4525: You… no, you and Rockrush seem to have been doing quite a lot behind the scenes?
soso.string.4528: …Come to think of it, ever since you came to town, I’ve received a lot of help from you.
soso.string.4529: …Surrounded by undead in the Deep Root Hollow, you took down the berserk undead.
soso.string.4530: In the battle with demons at Harves, I think you could have won on your own.
soso.string.4531: And now, at this moment of greatest crisis, you just happened to show up.
soso.string.4532: Is that a coincidence? I don’t think so—you came here with a purpose, didn’t you…
soso.string.4533: …Still won’t say? Is my strength really so unworthy of your trust? Then forget it.
soso.string.4534: You’re still carrying the short sword I gave you—if you still see me as a brother…
soso.string.4535: Then when you’re in danger, I’ll be sure to save you too.
soso.string.4538: No… I’m already deeply involved. Tell me! The truth.
soso.string.4539: I see… you’re heading to the Lost Forest to end this, right?
soso.string.4540: You can do it, can’t you?
soso.string.4541: Then… I’ll do what I can, so you’ll never regret trusting me.
soso.string.4543: From the scouts’ report… you rushed into the camp.
soso.string.4545: Still the same—not very good at hiding.
soso.string.4547: At least you escaped safely in the end… What did you go there for?
soso.string.4548: We just got back to Snow… unfortunately, we don’t know much about the situation here…
soso.string.4549: So seeing the camp destroyed by invading roots made us drop our guard…
soso.string.4550: Well then… let’s talk about the current situation…
soso.string.4551: Not long after you left town… I gathered the security force.
soso.string.4552: As expected, they quickly mobilized, suppressing Snow by force and searching for you.
soso.string.4553: Thanks to intel, most of the security force members escaped safely…
soso.string.4554: Now Snow is under the control of that brute Biaosu.
soso.string.4555: And the key point… a few days later, the lord came with a large army…
soso.string.4556: Then the camp collapsed, and the roots of the Holy Tree rampaged and tore it apart.
soso.string.4557: Countless monsters emerged from within… a scene like the end of days.
soso.string.4558: The stationed troops were drawn into the roots one after another, almost willingly…
soso.string.4559: Then they emerged from the roots transformed into monsters…
soso.string.4560: Fortunately, they seemed to retain their intelligence and didn’t attack people.
soso.string.4561: So we continued to lie low, waiting for the right moment…
soso.string.4562: If not for the intel you gave that day, things wouldn’t have gone so smoothly.
soso.string.4563: Thanks to that, we weren’t suppressed in ignorance and managed to secure reinforcements from the capital.
soso.string.4564: Soon, the Imperial Army will come to take down the lord and his men…
soso.string.4566: Two weeks ago… while in hiding, I saw the lord escort Priest Rockrush deep into the camp.
soso.string.4567: I believe the priest is still alive…
soso.string.4568: But… in the chaos of battle, I can’t guarantee it.
soso.string.4569: So I hope to rescue him before the subjugation force acts.
soso.string.4570: The land is torn apart by tangled roots…
soso.string.4571: Making it hard for me to search deeply…
soso.string.4572: Can I ask you to help rescue Rockrush?
soso.string.4573: Is that so? If he says so…
soso.string.4575: Perhaps he, like me, feels deeply the inadequacy of his own strength.
soso.string.4576: That time we went together to the transformed undead nest in the Holy Capital—Woten…
soso.string.4577: Witnessing the ancient warrior, the stationed army’s commander Biaosu… and your power…
soso.string.4578: That’s a height you can’t reach even after swinging a sword tens of millions of times…
soso.string.4579: I want to move forward with you just a little more… share a little more of the burden.
soso.string.4580: The subjugation army will arrive in two days—let’s meet him then.
soso.string.4582: That the Lost Forest, long a place of exile for sinners… could develop such a large village.
soso.string.4583: No historical records ever mentioned this…
soso.string.4584: It seems exiles gradually gathered here and built the village without notice.
soso.string.4585: And… this place is indeed connected to the sanctum.
soso.string.4586: Now the route into the sanctum is secured… what’s the next plan?
soso.string.4587: …There are no treants in this village.
soso.string.4588: I think they don’t know about this entrance.
soso.string.4589: The remnants resisting in Yeelte, the treants fighting demons in the fortress city of Seimen… and many reinforcements outside the Holy Spirit Tree Altar…
soso.string.4590: …I believe having this entrance known only to us is a huge advantage.
soso.string.4591: You mean to destroy the main gate…?
soso.string.4592: That’s right—if we seal the gate, then we’ll only need to deal with the few enemies inside the sanctum.
soso.string.4593: Makes sense… then our first objective is decided.
soso.string.4594: Let’s seize control of the gate together.
soso.string.4596: Yes, we successfully destroyed the gate. Everything fine outside?
soso.string.4597: This village really has no sign of treants—in fact… we even seem to be welcomed.
soso.string.4598: This is a potion from their shamans, with some peculiar power…
soso.string.4599: As long as there’s nothing strange, that’s good—securing the retreat route is up to you.
soso.string.4600: If there’s any change at the gate, please report it right away.
soso.string.4603: Partner, your strength truly can’t be underestimated.
soso.string.4604: The first time I fought alongside you was in the Root‑Burrow Deep Pit...
soso.string.4606: Because we didn’t understand the zombies, the team fell apart....
soso.string.4607: Thanks to you we made it out alive...
soso.string.4609: And the demon who appeared in Hafos Village was also felled by you...
soso.string.4610: Although you crushed our boss and the Yuan‑Chuan Plan, you steered the future toward a better ending.
soso.string.4612: Had they known you had such strength, they probably wouldn’t have rashly made you an enemy.
soso.string.4613: We could set foot here thanks to you seizing back the Forest of Lost Paths map the stationed legion had usurped....
soso.string.4615: And along the way you even stopped the revival of the Demon King, culprit of the Human–Demon War....
soso.string.4616: Though our first ritual at the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar was thwarted by Lanwang and failed.
soso.string.4619: But you were not afraid of failure... you set out for Banena again to seek the ritual’s core.
soso.string.4620: In the decisive battle against the stationed legion—despite running into the Erosion‑Dragon and Biao Su, who wouldn’t die no matter how he was attacked.
soso.string.4622: You still persevered, buying time until I broke the source of his regeneration.
soso.string.4623: Facing Lanwang transformed into a Treant, before whom we were all helpless.
soso.string.4626: You brought him down by your strength alone.
soso.string.4627: In the end you even felled the Erosion‑Dragon, allowing the ritual to be completed smoothly.
soso.string.4629: You saved humankind... saved the world!
soso.string.4630: Your valiant figure in battle spurs us onward...
soso.string.4631: You are fully deserving of the title of hero.
soso.string.4632: Although its power is a bit too great...
soso.string.4633: But I think you are the most suitable one to wield it...
soso.string.4634: Take it—this is the sword that suits you best!
soso.string.4635: Intruder...! Damn, he’s succeeded yet again!
soso.string.4636: But this time we absolutely won’t let you go!
soso.string.4637: Personnel have gathered; you can’t escape now.
soso.string.4640: 【Main Story Quest Book has been updated】.
soso.string.4641: Being able to sever my supply from the Sacred Tree with brute force alone truly startled me...
soso.string.4642: But now you are truly fragile—how pathetic...
soso.string.4643: Out of mana？ ...Had you unleashed that power earlier, the result would have been different.
soso.string.4644: So in the end... the one who least trusts humans to cooperate with demonfolk...
soso.string.4646: You concealed your own power and approached the ignorant.
soso.string.4647: Afraid to let them know you are demonfolk？ Your ideal will never become reality.
soso.string.4648: Maybe so, but... I will bring you down.
soso.string.4650: The altar’s actually been destroyed like this... just what is...
soso.string.4651: Looks like those two have gotten up as well...
soso.string.4654: This disastrous scene... all by his hand!
soso.string.4655: He isn’t human—he’s a cunning demon!
soso.string.4656: Tell me... what reaction are you expecting from us？
soso.string.4657: Watching someone fight for us... covered in wounds—no one could hate that person!
soso.string.4658: Leave the Treant grunts to me! I won’t let them hinder you!
soso.string.4659: You’ve cooperated with us in battle before; go all out and fight—let us support you!
soso.string.4660: Are you in your right minds! He’s a demon!
soso.string.4661: Yeah! To think a secret like that could shake our trust—that’d really make a partner like me sad!
soso.string.4662: Go on—give it everything; there’s no need to hide anything anymore!
soso.string.4663: You’re wrong! Wrong! Errors must be corrected!
soso.string.4666: The ritual can proceed smoothly now, however...
soso.string.4667: That’s right... you still cannot stop the curse.
soso.string.4668: So long as the Erosion‑Dragon remains alive, the curse will keep reviving.
soso.string.4669: My demise will only let the curse slip out of control, and then you will face...
soso.string.4670: an Erosion‑Dragon that fully absorbs and replaces the Sacred Tree, and endless undead.
soso.string.4671: They will indiscriminately attack all life on this continent, bringing annihilation to all life.
soso.string.4673: This is the consequence you brought upon yourselves! Be afraid, and repent!
soso.string.4676: No matter the obstacles, we will overcome them.
soso.string.4679: Then prove it to me—that the path you chose is right!
soso.string.4680: I do not wish to destroy humankind together with everything else...
soso.string.4681: I entrust this power to you； as one who seeks human–demon cooperation, you won’t refuse...
soso.string.4682: If you can, then stop it—let me see； I will witness everything in hell...
soso.string.4684: Did you come alone this time？
soso.string.4688: Even though all three of you failed just now...
soso.string.4690: Is this the source of your confidence？
soso.string.4691: Ah... yes... with such power, no one can stop me anymore.
soso.string.4692: I grew up in a city of peace, a magnificent capital under the Sacred Tree’s protection.
soso.string.4694: My parents, whom I never even met, died on the battlefield....
soso.string.4695: Perhaps out of pity？ I was sent to an orphanage under the Holy‑Tree Church.
soso.string.4697: There I suffered all kinds of exclusion... because I was not human.
soso.string.4698: I once despised humans, because you always assaulted me unreasonably...
soso.string.4700: You said your confidence comes from this power...
soso.string.4701: Then... what if we crush it？
soso.string.4703: Well, are you in the mood to talk now？
soso.string.4705: Not really... I’m merely one of the remnants whose lives were reaped by that war...
soso.string.4707: Being shunned was only natural for you! We took pity and let you live and you’re still not satisfied？
soso.string.4708: Back then the Holy Capital was destroyed by the Demon King; all humans were killed—you must have been delighted!
soso.string.4709: Too bad—our hero stopped it all in the end!
soso.string.4710: No; though tormented, in that hell I still had companions...
soso.string.4711: I realized... the label “human” isn’t everything: the Sacred Tree, Rock‑Gallop, Reig...
soso.string.4712: Everyone has a self beyond the label; that was why I raised my sword then and faced the Demon King...
soso.string.4715: I spared the eight clans’ chiefs and let them lead their people in retreat...
soso.string.4716: and at last ended the long Human–Demon War.
soso.string.4718: I firmly believe that beyond the label of demonfolk, they each have their own individuality.
soso.string.4719: I left the Holy Capital with them; the dead forest and the desert became their home.
soso.string.4720: For the survival of their race, they had no choice but to resort to plunder.
soso.string.4721: What a fine reason to rationalize war!
soso.string.4722: But in the eyes of the plundered, that’s nothing but an excuse!
soso.string.4723: You hate the demonfolk too, don’t you—you should become like me!
soso.string.4725: The Holy‑Tree Church, which reveres life and prosperity, has many techniques leveraging the land’s advantages.
soso.string.4726: So long as the demonfolk possess sufficient resources, there is no reason to start war again.
soso.string.4729: that one day we can advance hand in hand.
soso.string.4732: I will stand before you as your obstacle!
soso.string.4736: Told you already! I’m not your opponent!
soso.string.4737: Go on and hack away at this guy to your heart’s content!
soso.string.4738: I told you you’d regret it...
soso.string.4739: Well？ What are you thinking now？
soso.string.4741: Looks like this time you actually intend to face me, hm...
soso.string.4742: But I’ve spent a lot right now; that damned demonfolk had some strength...
soso.string.4743: So I’ll let him be your opponent...!
soso.string.4744: That expression on your face right now—perfect!
soso.string.4746: So you’re here; then let’s go quickly!
soso.string.4747: Powerful monsters roam the Withered‑Soul Dead Desert!
soso.string.4748: We really can’t linger! To hunt monsters with Green‑Soul Stone lodes, the Mirage Desert Boar is the best choice.
soso.string.4749: Pick a boar that’s massive and looks like it eats a lot; butcher it to take the stones.
soso.string.4750: Wait—that one... what kind of monster is that.
soso.string.4751: I’ve never seen a monster this massive here before.
soso.string.4752: This behemoth undoubtedly arose from the aberration!
soso.string.4754: The Tree’s influence is growing; looks like there isn’t much time left!
soso.string.4755: We must finish the Green‑Soul Spell Bead as soon as possible—this crisis is also an opportunity!
soso.string.4756: A monster that huge is bound to be loaded with Green‑Soul Stone ore!
soso.string.4757: Hunt it and you can gather the materials necessary to complete the Green‑Soul Spell Bead!
soso.string.4758: Mm... Sacred Tree magic doesn’t work on them at all.
soso.string.4759: Bringing you along was indeed the right choice.
soso.string.4760: To conserve See‑Through Magic’s mana, I’ll only support with small spells next.
soso.string.4761: I probably won’t be of much help; the fighting’s up to you.
soso.string.4762: Ah—so it’s dead already, huh. Though that bear was a big obstacle for us too.
soso.string.4763: At times I even felt a trace of companionship toward it...
soso.string.4764: Is it surprising I showed up here？ We don’t let any happenings in the mountains, big or small, slip by.
soso.string.4765: Let alone a battle this fierce.
soso.string.4766: In the end you still ignored my advice and handed over the letter.
soso.string.4767: Let me guess—you’re here now because they want you to clear obstacles for their march, right.
soso.string.4768: And the next target is probably us, isn’t it.
soso.string.4769: We will not stop our raids.
soso.string.4770: Just as you have your mission to fulfill, I also have things I cannot but do.
soso.string.4771: Next time let us fight in the cave’s deepest part.
soso.string.4773: That day, after holding up the enemy pursuit for a while, I was subdued...
soso.string.4774: They had no intention of killing me... perhaps that is a taboo for those who have become monsters...
soso.string.4775: To our eyes they are undoubtedly monsters... but they still consider themselves human...
soso.string.4776: Killing without scruple... would make them lose their identity as human.
soso.string.4777: That’s probably how I survived—how ironic...
soso.string.4778: To reach today we stirred up a tide of undead...
soso.string.4779: so many innocent people were sacrificed... yet when it comes to killing with my own hands, I can’t do it...
soso.string.4780: Before long the Imperial Army’s subjugation unit will arrive...
soso.string.4781: When the time comes, I’ll trouble you to take me away... under the influence of their spellcraft this place is full of Sacred Tree mana...
soso.string.4782: And I can study their spellcraft at close range; I hope to stay here a while longer...
soso.string.4783: The subjugation operation will probably be the final deadline...
soso.string.4784: Whatever the result... it will be the last straw crushing their humanity...
soso.string.4785: Feels like it’s just a little short...
soso.string.4786: With a bit more time, I’ll grasp something...
soso.string.4787: No choice—the subjugation operation has already begun; we have to go.
soso.string.4788: Mm... this is far enough; let’s move.
soso.string.4789: You were dragged into the endless time‑space by the drifters and died.
soso.string.4793: Many monsters are barring the way....
soso.string.4794: With bodies thick as giant trees—they’re very abnormal foes...
soso.string.4795: So these are Treants... the private soldiers Lanwang brought to the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar.
soso.string.4796: Then... it’s no accident they’re blocking us here—be careful... don’t take them head‑on.
soso.string.4798: Why won’t you stop hounding me!
soso.string.4799: The Eastern Deep Forest... the entry method？ But... please, don’t kill me!
soso.string.4800: No... you won’t kill me...? The smuggling route we Silver Wolf Bandits use to get into the Eastern Deep Forest...
soso.string.4801: It’s hidden in the water well at the center of Seimen; we knocked open a hole in the city’s sewer system.
soso.string.4802: And that hole connects to a natural cave in the Deep Forest; that’s how we smuggled ourselves out.
soso.string.4803: I’ve told you everything I can—let me go!
soso.string.4805: The weapons here are a great fit for you! And be sure to check out the “Imperial‑style” enchantments... looking to ask about something？
soso.string.4806: Want Green‑Soul weapons？ Why would you want that kind of thing!
soso.string.4807: I suggest you stop asking around; those are weapons used by the demonfolk.
soso.string.4808: They were banned a year ago, and as an honored member of the Imperial Workshop how could I possibly...
soso.string.4809: No... except for that guy Zhonghua, can’t say—go find him; only a weirdo like that would still be stashing Green‑Soul weapons now.
soso.string.4810: Who knows what smuggling route that is!
soso.string.4811: The Eastern Deep Forest is crawling with terrifying monsters and demonfolk; who would want to go there.
soso.string.4812: Smuggling？ Rather than that, how about buying our Imperial‑style fine weapons.
soso.string.4813: Cheap and sturdy Imperial‑style weapons—buy now for just 100 Gold!
soso.string.4814: Powerful “Imperial‑style” enchantments; great for any class.
soso.string.4815: This weapon here suits you perfectly! Be sure to check it out.
soso.string.4817: So the Silver Wolf Bandits amount to just this; Lanwang is overly cautious...
soso.string.4818: Even if there were another Shunchang or two, it’d be no big deal!
soso.string.4819: In the end he’s just someone who refuses revenge and refuses power... ah, nothing!
soso.string.4820: Thank you for your service as Sno’s messenger.
soso.string.4821: You braved many hardships and handed over Sno’s—the Empire’s—crisis to us.
soso.string.4822: We will soon take over the undead problem in its entirety.
soso.string.4823: As for manpower shortages, second and third waves will arrive soon.
soso.string.4824: There’s nothing to worry about anymore.
soso.string.4825: Stand down; you and the town’s guard captain... talk with Reig.
soso.string.4827: What is it you’re worried about？
soso.string.4828: Mining rights to the mithril mine？ Or the cost of garrisoning troops？
soso.string.4829: I’ve already said it: we don’t need you.
soso.string.4830: Do you currently have the spare capacity to mine enough mithril？.
soso.string.4831: As for the cost of the garrison, we can cover it by mining mithril on your behalf to earn the funds.
soso.string.4832: Beyond this, we will make no other demands.
soso.string.4833: Still not satisfied？ Fine, have you help drive out the undead.
soso.string.4834: Call Reig over! Let’s see how many undead you can help us expel!
soso.string.4836: What wind is blowing today that actually brought Bishop Rock‑Gallop here in person.
soso.string.4837: No... no need for hospitality; I am but a humble cleric.
soso.string.4838: I came today to confirm the information heard from
soso.string.4840: It seems your garrison has looted quite a few artifacts from the underground ruins!
soso.string.4841: Those artifacts taken from the Holy Capital ─ Woden belong to the Holy‑Tree Church!
soso.string.4842: Of course we’re not asking you to hand them over for free; we...
soso.string.4843: Then you may leave. No matter the price, we will not hand them over!
soso.string.4845: This is not merely my view; it is also the view of Lord Lanwang, who governs this place!
soso.string.4846: Do you... realize that saying this is tantamount to declaring war on our Holy‑Tree Church？
soso.string.4847: Seizing our Church’s assets, and yet...
soso.string.4848: Hah, don’t make me laugh! So what if we declare war on you？ And here’s another bit of good news for you.
soso.string.4849: The cause of the Sacred Tree aberration you’ve been investigating all along—was orchestrated by us.
soso.string.4850: So you know the culprit？ And then？ What can you do to me？
soso.string.4852: Only after we used sorcery to distort the Sacred Tree to this extent did your Holy‑Tree Church finally notice the anomaly.
soso.string.4853: It’s a far cry from the Holy‑Tree Church at the height of its power seventy years ago.
soso.string.4854: You think I’d be afraid to go to war with you？
soso.string.4855: You’d best remember what you said today...
soso.string.4858: ...Lanwang has always been wary of you; you possess inexplicably great power and, for some reason, linger in this place.
soso.string.4859: At last I know your identity today: a warrior sent by the Holy‑Tree Church？
soso.string.4860: Presumably a very high‑level warrior at that... ordered to investigate the aberration？
soso.string.4861: It’s useless; at this stage nothing can be undone!
soso.string.4862: How about it？ Come to my side; since you want the map in my hands, that means...
soso.string.4863: you hold the key phrase to enter and exit the altar, right？ We also have the support of quite a few high clergy of the Holy‑Tree Church.
soso.string.4864: Yet none of us knows the key phrase; personally I hold your strength in high regard as well...
soso.string.4866: To have such strength yet waste it... listen!
soso.string.4867: Though they are much more compliant now, those people seventy years ago... no, from even earlier...
soso.string.4868: were plunderers of humankind; this is a history written in blood.
soso.string.4869: Forgiveness？ What a joke. Have you seen what Shunchang was like？
soso.string.4870: Soldiers like that will appear by the tens of thousands.
soso.string.4871: The demonfolk will soon be crushed by us.
soso.string.4874: ...Don’t play dumb; in Sno, the only one with the skills to pull this off is you.
soso.string.4875: Tight‑lipped, are we... Speak! Where did the map go!
soso.string.4876: Think I don’t dare do anything to you？! Even if you’re strong, to me you’re just a third‑rate hack.
soso.string.4877: Hey, hey! Don’t bully my member, okay...？
soso.string.4879: This person was in the Security Corps dorm all last night, so there’s no way he could have come make trouble here.
soso.string.4880: ...Or are you saying your mighty garrison could be infiltrated by a petty thief from the Security Corps—and even let him escape？
soso.string.4881: Hmph, slick talker; your testimony has no credibility!
soso.string.4882: No matter what, you insist on framing my member？
soso.string.4884: Then I will withdraw our request for aid!
soso.string.4885: You’ve gone too far! Though it will take some time, I will have the Imperial Capital dispatch a knight order to protect Sno.
soso.string.4886: We don’t need you here—beat it.
soso.string.4887: Are you sure？ While you wait for the knight order, quite a few victims will appear, you know!
soso.string.4888: How is that any different from now？ Right before my eyes a brother is about to die because of you.
soso.string.4889: ...Fine, enjoy your little victory; now is not the time to clash head‑on with the Imperial center.
soso.string.4890: I won’t arrest the man, but
soso.string.4891: before long I’ll teach you a lesson.
soso.string.4892: Let’s go; this isn’t a convenient place to talk.
soso.string.4894: Before anyone comes to interfere, quickly destroy the gate!
soso.string.4895: Behind this gate it’s all distorted...
soso.string.4896: Mm... but it will surely be repaired soon.
soso.string.4897: This only buys a little time; regroup a bit... we have to seize the Sacred‑Tree Altar’s control as soon as possible.
soso.string.4898: O mighty one with strength! How do you intend to resolve the Sacred Tree problem.
soso.string.4899: We demonfolk have a strong sense for mana.
soso.string.4900: In the western human domain, an enormous mana is stirring and transforming.
soso.string.4901: The Sacred Tree’s mana is shifting—turning into something dark and corrupt...
soso.string.4902: Humans seem to be planning to do something with the Tree’s mana, aren’t they？
soso.string.4903: Let humans solve human problems; now, tell me your solution...
soso.string.4904: Zombies... and Green‑Soul Stone？ You swore to resolve the aberration, yet your grasp of the aberration itself is this shallow？
soso.string.4905: ...Burning the Sacred Tree outright is the fastest method, though I doubt you could accept that.
soso.string.4906: ...Since I lost to you I’ll respect you, and offer some guidance.
soso.string.4907: You do need Green‑Soul Stone, but not merely to deal with zombies.
soso.string.4908: This aberration was wrought by dark sorcery.
soso.string.4909: Using the Sacred Tree’s mana to create zombies, then using the zombies as a medium to infect the Sacred Tree’s mana.
soso.string.4910: The infected mana then creates yet more zombies—a near‑endless perpetual‑motion mechanism.
soso.string.4911: If you won’t destroy the Sacred Tree, the source of the mana supply, then you can only destroy the sorcery.
soso.string.4912: However, every zombie is a core of the sorcery; only by eradicating all zombies simultaneously can the sorcery be lifted.
soso.string.4913: That’s impossible under normal circumstances—except... with a spell that uses Green‑Soul Stone as its core.
soso.string.4914: This spell is a forbidden curse that drains the target’s life and mana, cast at the Sacred Tree’s mana convergence point.
soso.string.4915: It can curse the Sacred Tree and all zombies that draw power from it at the same time.
soso.string.4916: Though it will leave a grievous scar on the Sacred Tree, it can eradicate all the sorcery.
soso.string.4917: Go find our army’s smith—Taixin; have him make you a Green‑Soul Spell Bead sufficient to serve as the spell’s core.
soso.string.4918: I heard that during the materials‑gathering you were attacked by a jet‑black giant beast.
soso.string.4919: Hmph, don’t flatter yourself! With your power, a mere oversized beast is no match for you.
soso.string.4920: But... as expected, the time left to us is short; the Sacred Tree’s tainted mana is spreading.
soso.string.4921: Wild animals that touch this mana will have their life‑force strengthened and become more ferocious.
soso.string.4922: Such terrifying beasts will keep appearing, and ever more frequently, so long as the Sacred Tree’s aberration is not stopped.
soso.string.4923: Let me confirm once more: “Do not use power to enslave humans; use power to protect them,” correct？
soso.string.4924: In recent years the demonfolk truly do live better than before; the clans of the Demon Generals... all the tribes have become far more prosperous.
soso.string.4925: To thrive even on this wild land was unthinkable in the past.
soso.string.4926: Learning human technology rather than plundering humanachievements—just this change alone produced such a transformation.
soso.string.4927: I can believe in the change you brought; the Sacred Tree’s crisis will be resolved by you.
soso.string.4928: All right. Let’s go; Taixin’s craft is no fraud—the Spell Bead must be finished by now.
soso.string.4929: Don’t keep him waiting too long!
soso.string.4930: It’s been a long time... if you’re here, it’s probably not good news...
soso.string.4931: ...You couldn’t stop it？ It’s not your fault... I didn’t expect a human’s obsession to run so deep...
soso.string.4932: To raise his sync with the sorcery so high... he can never return to human form.
soso.string.4933: You... no—would you consider destroying the Sacred Tree？ This near‑obsessive human curse is steadily growing stronger.
soso.string.4934: On the way here you saw them as well—humans turned into Treants.
soso.string.4935: The Treants that appear in this pitch‑black forest are still weak... but you’ve met far stronger Treants... right？
soso.string.4936: The Treants at the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar... no matter how you attack, it’s difficult to do any damage.
soso.string.4937: The closer they are to the Sacred Tree that is the source, the greater power the Treants gain.
soso.string.4938: And as the curse worsens, powerful Treants can move across a wider area.
soso.string.4939: Unless you eradicate the curse or annihilate the source, the Treants’ undying nature will not be lifted.
soso.string.4940: The eight Demon Generals are converging here, and together with you, you will surely accomplish what the previous Demon King never achieved.
soso.string.4941: ...Very well, human—if you still wish to strive under that identity.
soso.string.4942: I’ve sent warriors and Taixin to seek Green‑Soul Stone for the war.
soso.string.4943: They’ll be back in a few days; if there’s suitable Green‑Soul Stone you’ll take it to make the core.
soso.string.4944: In the meantime, there are some supplies we need you to obtain from human society.
soso.string.4947: Green‑Soul weapons？ Those are contraband—you dare ask me that to my face？
soso.string.4948: Pass through here？ No, that’s impossible.
soso.string.4949: Without the lord’s consent, no one passes this point.
soso.string.4950: Let alone your goal—mining Green‑Soul Stone？ That’s contraband.
soso.string.4951: No. You’re not getting through; scram and stop bothering me.
soso.string.4952: You have no right to pass!
soso.string.4954: You need to obtain the lord’s approval.
soso.string.4956: You managed to avoid fighting quite well...!
soso.string.4957: But should I say... as expected？ Sno is under their control now...!
soso.string.4958: Mm... along the way it’s all Lanwang’s monster Treant army...
soso.string.4959: ...They aren’t even bothering to cover it up anymore...
soso.string.4960: Which means they no longer need to hide it—or...？...
soso.string.4961: Anyway, we need to gather some intel....
soso.string.4962: Please get intel from the stationed camp ─ Yerte...？
soso.string.4963: It’s a dangerous mission, but... I believe you can do it...
soso.string.4964: Up ahead... Lanwang’s army is garrisoned; the road to the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar is blocked...
soso.string.4965: Seems they planned it... we have no choice but to pass this road....
soso.string.4966: Against an army like this... we really have no way, and we can’t expect reinforcements now...
soso.string.4967: Remember inside the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar？ There are drifters inside—few, but they are there...
soso.string.4968: No... but there’s no helping it—we can only take a gamble!？.
soso.string.4969: Dealing with the drifters in the Forest of Lost Paths is asking to die... and you know that!.
soso.string.4970: No way？ You intend to talk with the drifters？.？
soso.string.4971: Talking with the drifters in the Forest of Lost Paths is suicidal... it’s not like you don’t know that!
soso.string.4972: No... but there’s nothing we can do—we can only bet it all!
soso.string.4974: Green‑Soul weapons？ Sadly, I don’t have any; the lord especially hates demonfolk‑related things!.
soso.string.4975: Every weapon is a tradition—ore‑processing technique, refined aesthetic design, and the artisan’s craftsmanship. If only I had Green‑Soul weapons to study.
soso.string.4976: Green‑Soul weapons are precious demonfolk‑technology research samples; unfortunately I can’t get my hands on them.
soso.string.4977: I really can’t get close to Green‑Soul weapons... that brat...
soso.string.4978: All right, I do have a Green‑Soul weapon on hand! That punk actually went around blabbing.
soso.string.4979: So what do you want？ Hand me over to the officers？ And have the weapon destroyed？
soso.string.4980: I don’t intend to hand it over for free... how about this.
soso.string.4981: Bring me ten tomb‑looted gold goods and ten mithril ingots, and I’ll hand you the Green‑Soul Sword I have.
soso.string.4982: You haven’t brought enough mithril ingots.
soso.string.4983: You haven’t brought enough tomb‑looted gold goods.
soso.string.4985: Fine. I only meant to give you a hard time—getting ten mithril ingots here is nearly impossible.
soso.string.4986: So you’re from Sno—no wonder. All right... we’ll honor the deal.
soso.string.4987: I’ll entrust this Green‑Soul Sword to you.
soso.string.4989: This sword is a rare treasure seized from a felled Demon General during the Great War of the past.
soso.string.4990: Even among demonfolk settlements, Green‑Soul weapons are quite rare.
soso.string.4991: Take good care of it—don’t break it!
soso.string.4992: 《A rapid knocking sound comes from afar.》
soso.string.4993: Seriously... so many visitors today... did you sell me out!
soso.string.4995: Are you the one who took down the general？
soso.string.4997: Though the general is rather impulsive, in the realm of pyromancy he’s unquestionably among the top of the demonfolk.
soso.string.4998: The last time he was beaten head‑on within his own domain was decades ago.
soso.string.4999: Thanks to you I’ve got fresh material to tease him with again.
soso.string.5000: Looking for a Green‑Soul Spell Bead？ Of course... I’d love to say “sure” but...
soso.string.5001: But we lack both materials and tools; Green‑Soul Stone weapons are arms that only a few elites among the demonfolk can even wield.
soso.string.5002: Being able to use a Green‑Soul weapon at all is a symbol of status and strength...
soso.string.5003: ...Why？ Because both processing and maintenance of Green‑Soul Stone are extremely difficult!
soso.string.5004: This isn’t me giving you a hard time... anyway, if you want the Green‑Soul Spell Bead, bring back materials for the processing tool from the Withered‑Soul Dead Desert: 『Gnaw‑Fox Razor Fangs ×14、Dead‑Domain honey ×3、Dead‑Soul Tree branches ×3』!
soso.string.5005: Looks like the materials are still a bit short!
soso.string.5006: That was fast! You’ve already gathered all the materials.
soso.string.5008: But the Green‑Soul Stone processing tool is made using exactly these things!
soso.string.5009: First... grind up these razor fangs taken from the Gnaw‑Fox!
soso.string.5010: These Gnaw‑Foxes are especially troublesome! They quietly blend into the environment, then strike out of nowhere.
soso.string.5011: Getting bitten by those fangs hurts, doesn’t it—these are fangs sharp enough to pierce a person straight through together with their metal armor.
soso.string.5012: Next is this honey—the life essence of Dead‑Soul Trees that grow in the desert.
soso.string.5013: It embodies a fierce will to live; pour it over the powdered fangs.
soso.string.5014: See! The ground‑up fang powder starts to grow and solidify with the surrounding powder.
soso.string.5015: The Dead‑Soul Tree is a wondrous species that can survive only in the desert; it draws nutrients from the earth without end.
soso.string.5016: If it grows outside the desert, its excessive absorption will instead cause it to self‑destruct.
soso.string.5017: Only the Dead‑Domain venom bees know how to obtain the pure life essence from these trees.
soso.string.5018: Final assembly... done! Here in the Withered‑Soul Dead Desert, life is made manifest...
soso.string.5019: A Green‑Soul Stone processing tool known only to the demonfolk... the method to make the Gnaw‑Fox Fang Pick!
soso.string.5020: With the processing tool ready, next is... the usual: go gather Green‑Soul Stone ore!
soso.string.5021: It’s Dead‑Soul Tree chyme taken from the intestines of a creature... in the desert... far stronger than the Gnaw‑Fox!
soso.string.5022: Go gather: 『Gnaw‑Fox Razor Fangs ×4、Dead‑Domain honey ×16、Green‑Soul Stone ore ×4』!
soso.string.5023: But... none of this will be usable.
soso.string.5024: Sigh... it will still suffice for making ordinary Green‑Soul weapons.
soso.string.5025: But as the casting core of a great spell—the Green‑Soul Spell Bead—it’s far from enough.
soso.string.5026: If you don’t believe me, pour this honey over the ore; it will stimulate the Dead‑Soul Tree chyme that creature chewed, digested, and compacted.
soso.string.5027: It will grow into higher‑density Green‑Soul crystal ore; then use the Gnaw‑Fox Razor Pick to chisel open the overly weak outer shell to obtain Green‑Soul Stone.
soso.string.5028: But even then it isn’t large enough... you’ll need to defeat an even stronger foe.
soso.string.5029: ...All right! I’ll assist you—facing a strong foe calls for another pair of hands.
soso.string.5030: And if I’m with you, I can process the freshly mined Green‑Soul ore on the spot.
soso.string.5031: If you’re pressed for time, just call me anytime; I’ll adjust my gear for gathering!
soso.string.5034: From the intel you brought back, I estimate that the tentacled monster is an aberration from the Root‑Burrow Deep Pit!
soso.string.5035: Originally I intended to seal it by invoking Shishu from the shamanic spell you brought back....
soso.string.5036: But using only the Sacred Tree element that humans aren’t adept with, it failed.
soso.string.5037: Humans are actually better at invoking the composite system of Shishu... sadly, too many methods have been lost.
soso.string.5038: No problem at all; let’s keep cooperating like this.
soso.string.5039: I’ll entrust the ritual core you obtained to you; it’s material transformed by implanting Shishu《Ghost‑Orchid》 into a corpse and then extracting it.
soso.string.5040: Though its performance is far below that of a complete Shishu, using it to seal the tentacled monster’s activity is a fairly standard operation.
soso.string.5041: Place the ritual core at the “altar,” and after detecting activity, activate the limiting function.
soso.string.5042: It feels less like blocking the enemy’s attacks and more like stopping its invasive assault....
soso.string.5043: Wahaha! Using the above method, it looks like we successfully restrained the tentacled monster!.
soso.string.5044: Then let’s do just that! Bring back some more Green‑Soul crystal ore so we can prepare to make a new Green‑Soul Spell Bead...
soso.string.5045: It seems using the Green‑Soul weapon is still a bit awkward; can you hand it to me and let me take a look？...
soso.string.5046: This kind of adverse reaction occurred when wielding the Green‑Soul weapon....
soso.string.5047: Applying 《Ghost‑Orchid》 to the living does indeed drive people mad—after all, it’s a mystic energy keyed to the dead... Fortunately this version is only a temporary processed product.
soso.string.5048: The derangement is very likely due to insufficient invocation functionality; you can also see it doesn’t attune as well as it did for the previous Transformed one.
soso.string.5049: I’ll continue to make corrections—when facing that kind of terrible curse, lacking normal judgment... is the scariest thing of all...？
soso.string.5050: The revision will lean toward separation rather than fusion with the human body... which also means the spell bead will be easier for anyone to use....
soso.string.5051: Of course, it’s not that you can’t use a Green‑Soul weapon....
soso.string.5052: I personally prefer processing Green‑Soul Stone to craft suitable tools...
soso.string.5053: Supporting anomalous things like Green‑Soul Stone without fusing them into the human body....
soso.string.5054: Yet I don’t reject the hope that the final Green‑Soul Spell Bead could serve as a portable spring of cleansing—flowing outside the body and sipped in small amounts....
soso.string.5055: And when its sustained concentration is sufficiently pure and stable, it could fuse with any tool...
soso.string.5056: Mm... if we keep on like this... I think perhaps we can pull humanity out of the deep pit of curses....
soso.string.5057: Sorry... sorry... every time a warrior is swallowed by the curse... that soul that vanishes from then on...
soso.string.5058: I can’t help feeling... it’s somehow my fault....
soso.string.5059: Too many people have been swallowed up in this world... reducing the sacrifices is so hard...？
soso.string.5060: For this dying world, I’ll work even harder....
soso.string.5061: Judging from your corrections to the incantation text, you’re a genius; your learning ability really differs from the locals....
soso.string.5062: For now, keep cleansing the polluted mana from 《inside the camp》...
soso.string.5063: After that, send the child and their parents... to a place they can live....
soso.string.5064: If you find a village that will take them in... that would be wonderful...？
soso.string.5065: The “Volunteer Monks” will go take them away; that will do...!
soso.string.5066: Before you rescued me... the place I was about to be sent to was...
soso.string.5067: Someone will come take over—as long as we don’t get noticed by the very top... it won’t be a big problem...!
soso.string.5068: Then let’s leave here for now...!
soso.string.5069: One last time... let’s go back to Banena... and help the demonfolk....
soso.string.5070: Yes... on this chaotic land... besides humans... there are those who protect this world....
soso.string.5071: It’s just that this time... things are bad enough... that we can only pin our hopes on them...？
soso.string.5075: Are nothing but another group of aberrations....
soso.string.5077: I, a madman, want to take back my homeland... the pain brought by the curse is harsher than the outcomes people make up...？
soso.string.5078: At that time... I completely forgot those people weren’t you...
soso.string.5080: My birthplace... just thinking of it... makes my chest... ache...!
soso.string.5081: Because... my homeland... was swallowed by the curse...？
soso.string.5082: Those towns on the snowfields... one after another... were swallowed...
soso.string.5083: Those people... the people... I saved no one...
soso.string.5084: If we want to turn that... into something else... somewhere people can settle... where children can cry...
soso.string.5085: Then... we have to... uproot the source of those curses.......
soso.string.5086: My homeland was destroyed by the undead; to take it back...
soso.string.5087: ...I see； to stop these things from happening...
soso.string.5088: Our boss and members gave their lives to seal off the mountain range, and it still failed？
soso.string.5089: ...Where exactly did we go wrong？ Since Lanwang took control of the Sacred Tree... the situation deteriorated all at once...
soso.string.5090: ...Soldiers transformed into aberrations like the boss were sent in an endless stream from Sno to the Eastern Legion.
soso.string.5091: ...Then, under the pretext of anomaly reconnaissance, they were sent into the Eastern Deep Forest to fight the demonfolk.
soso.string.5092: You want to ask me to lead you through the secret route to Banena once more...
soso.string.5093: But that’s a bit difficult... as the battle intensified, the demonfolk sealed the secret route on their side...
soso.string.5094: Leaving a path that might allow a strike from behind is too dangerous for them...
soso.string.5095: ...This may be the war between humans and demonfolk in which humans have won the most.
soso.string.5096: But... without a doubt this is wrong； I’ll arrange for you to pass through the checkpoint into the Eastern Deep Forest...
soso.string.5098: Well？ Did you reach Banena smoothly？
soso.string.5099: ...It seems this batch of supplies is very important to them.
soso.string.5100: The things they asked us to collect before the secret route was closed...
soso.string.5101: A large amount of Recovery Potions and mithril ingots for crafting excellent gear.
soso.string.5102: But... it’s a bit too much; having you carry it all alone will likely hinder your movement.
soso.string.5103: Need my help...? Bring me along and I can lighten your load...
soso.string.5106: All right... I’ll keep pace with you.
soso.string.5107: Mm, then I’ll trouble you all with transporting these supplies.
soso.string.5108: Very well... if you judge I’ll only hold you back.
soso.string.5109: Mm, then I’ll trouble you to carry these supplies; please make sure to deliver them to Banena.
soso.string.5110: Sigh, can’t be helped... entrusting such a huge load to just you alone.
soso.string.5111: That itself is foolish; we should have gauged an appropriate amount.
soso.string.5112: Sorry... I held you back; if you’d been able to fight at full strength without worrying about me, perhaps the result would be different.
soso.string.5113: You already did your utmost... as expected, it’s hard to send a huge load of supplies across the battlefield to Banena.
soso.string.5114: But... I truly didn’t expect Biao Su to appear on the battlefield—he was still commanding the stationed army in Sno days ago.
soso.string.5115: Running into him is nothing short of a disaster...
soso.string.5116: From your description... he seems to have power far beyond other Treants.
soso.string.5117: Something’s off; the Sacred Tree’s mana in the border region is much thinner than in Sno.
soso.string.5118: A Treant that strong shouldn’t be able to appear here yet—the Sacred Tree’s cursed mana is insufficient.
soso.string.5119: If he’s felled... especially by a Green‑Soul weapon wielded by a Demon General, his undying nature will collapse.
soso.string.5120: ...At least for now we shouldn’t be facing him here.
soso.string.5121: Perhaps he has a mission—like subjugating an enemy general...？
soso.string.5122: Or pushing forward a suppressed front line... any way you look at it, it’s bad.
soso.string.5123: We must quickly re‑procure supplies to hand over to the demonfolk.
soso.string.5124: In the short term it’ll be hard to prepare a huge amount; just get 『Recovery Potions ×64, mithril ingots ×10』 for now.
soso.string.5125: That way your movement won’t be hindered.
soso.string.5126: I can brew the Recovery Potions; I can finish the preparations.
soso.string.5127: Then I’ll trouble you with the 『mithril ingots ×10』; hand them to me when ready so I can bundle them together.
soso.string.5128: We need 『10 mithril ingots』... I’m counting on you to get them.
soso.string.5129: Much appreciated... that should be enough supplies.
soso.string.5130: This time I’ll trouble you to transport alone—cut across the battlefield as fast as you can.
soso.string.5131: I have a bad feeling; maybe... it’s already too late.
soso.string.5133: You successfully brought back the ritual’s core! That’ll be the best means to counter Lanwang...
soso.string.5134: ...But our main helpers among the demonfolk, the Flame Clan, took a heavy blow.
soso.string.5135: Counting on further demonfolk support is now almost impossible...
soso.string.5136: A pity to lose their support... but it can’t be helped.
soso.string.5137: Mm... let’s go. Our bandit group has a secret path through the Mengteng Mountain Range to avoid the lord’s army.
soso.string.5140: ...You wouldn’t feel anything about Yuan‑Chuan’s death, would you—they’re demonfolk, not humans!
soso.string.5141: It’s only right they helped handle this; if it isn’t handled, Lanwang’s next target will be them.
soso.string.5142: ...Don’t be foolish. If they could have smashed Seimen by force, they would’ve done it long ago. Helping our bandit group and you is only because they can’t.
soso.string.5143: It isn’t out of respect for us. All right... let’s go! We still have things we must do.
soso.string.5144: Having to compile reports constantly is a pain!
soso.string.5145: Running back and forth every day is exhausting.
soso.string.5146: I’m just a messenger—don’t take it out on me.
soso.string.5148: Even with Lord Yuan‑Chuan present, you looked weakened... so then.......
soso.string.5149: Gwah... utterly no match... are you really human......
soso.string.5150: Eek eek eek... spare me...... I only did it to survive...
soso.string.5151: Our bandit group used to be the Mengteng Mountain patrol unit... one day the boss brought back something unbelievable.
soso.string.5152: He was often ordered to support Biao Su’s Eastern Deep Forest patrol unit—maybe that’s why...
soso.string.5153: We learned... the demonfolk... the Sixth Demon General was about to attack Seimen.
soso.string.5154: That legendary monster was coming for us—we had no choice!!.
soso.string.5155: No hero, no champion; if they came now, we’d be finished.
soso.string.5156: The boss knew the situation, so he went to find Lanwang!
soso.string.5157: Then he came back covered head to toe in roots—hardly recognizable...
soso.string.5158: The boss said Lanwang had no intention of stopping or preventing the war...
soso.string.5159: Back then the Human–Demon War ended with the hero defeating the demonfolk...
soso.string.5160: and not with the annihilation of demonfolk...
soso.string.5161: Lanwang’s gone mad—his hatred for the demonfolk has driven him insane.
soso.string.5162: He’s pinning his hopes on an ominous power to kill all demonfolk.
soso.string.5163: Seeing the boss’s state, we knew we could defeat the demonfolk.
soso.string.5164: But we would no longer be human.
soso.string.5165: The boss made his decision—to join hands with the demonfolk and fulfill their demand.
soso.string.5166: Then, sneak back into the sewers; I’ll arrange for you to meet Lord Yuan‑Chuan.
soso.string.5168: so long as it still lives in the world, the ritual’s power won’t be enough to eradicate the curse...
soso.string.5174: ...The curse has slipped free of human control.
soso.string.5176: What do we do—the monsters are still pouring out!
soso.string.5177: Hold the ritual...! Use the ritual’s power to purge the cursed monsters...
soso.string.5178: Reig, Kadon, Wange—the monsters breaking into the ritual site are yours to deal with!
soso.string.5179: I’m counting on you... go bring down the Erosion‑Dragon!
soso.string.5180: Only you can do this—please, end it all!
soso.string.5181: We’re counting on you... I believe you can do it!
soso.string.5182: The holding unit has already started moving.
soso.string.5183: Next we just have to rendezvous with Duanxian.
soso.string.5184: Let’s go; we can’t afford any delay.
soso.string.5185: I often hide behind the door.
soso.string.5186: I am an anomaly different from them—a wholly different existence.
soso.string.5187: I am unwelcome among them—a despised existence.
soso.string.5188: Some adults look at me as if they’re seeing filth.
soso.string.5190: But I have companions by my side.
soso.string.5191: Therefore I drew my sword to face them, without a shred of hesitation.
soso.string.5192: The supplies seem a bit heavy...
soso.string.5193: But getting across the battlefield to Banena is still no problem...
soso.string.5194: My strength is slight, but I will also help fight the Treants.
soso.string.5195: If we give up fighting out of fear... everything ends.
soso.string.5198: Didn’t expect to run into you on this battlefield.
soso.string.5199: Looks like the formidable foe my men reported encountering a few days ago was you.
soso.string.5200: Before I formally take the field, I suppose I can use you to warm up a bit.
soso.string.5201: ...The strongest Enchanter is here—you absolutely can’t escape.
soso.string.5202: ...Damn it! Don’t think you can run just because you dealt with the Enchanter.
soso.string.5203: It seems the supplies will be hard to deliver...
soso.string.5206: If you don’t finish me here, you’ll regret it!
soso.string.5208: Looks like the route from the chapel to the gate has been blocked.
soso.string.5209: Head up to the second floor, then jump down to the gate from above—same difference.
soso.string.5210: These guys seem to have gotten stronger.......
soso.string.5211: This is the Sacred Tree’s mana convergence point... all Treants are greatly empowered here.
soso.string.5213: Then hop over the railing from the second floor and drop down...
soso.string.5214: Mm, that gets us to the gate...
soso.string.5216: No helping it... forcing our way in here must’ve already exposed the intrusion!
soso.string.5218: Keh‑ha... hold the gate to the death!
soso.string.5220: Good grief... isn’t that the monster from the Root‑Burrow Deep Pit!
soso.string.5221: It’s fine! We’ve grown a lot since that day!
soso.string.5223: I see... you’ve decided to subjugate the demonfolk？
soso.string.5224: I’ve been observing him for a while; perhaps the timing is just right...
soso.string.5225: Though he just sits quietly in that plaza, the terrifying aura keeps swelling.
soso.string.5226: He’s hoarding energy; I don’t know what for, but it certainly isn’t good.
soso.string.5227: Let’s go—hopefully we can make it in time.
soso.string.5228: Truly worthy of the former Pontiff of the Holy‑Tree Church!
soso.string.5229: Even after losing his reason, still this powerful...
soso.string.5230: Thanks to him we also obtained the key phrase for the gate.
soso.string.5231: I’ll head to the surface first...
soso.string.5232: If a foe repents his deeds, can restitution become your salvation...
soso.string.5236: Even if you are... I will surely forgive you!
soso.string.5238: It’ll be bad if the Imperial Army spots us.
soso.string.5239: It’s corroded and worn—hard to identify.
soso.string.5240: But this is indeed old‑style Templar gear.
soso.string.5241: They must have been powerful knights in life.
soso.string.5243: How pitiful—to be reborn with twisted life.
soso.string.5244: Unable to live and unable to die.
soso.string.5245: I promise I will resolve this incident.
soso.string.5246: This is the last of them.
soso.string.5247: Take them out, then prepare the ritual!!.
soso.string.5249: After the ritual I’ll have little mana left!
soso.string.5250: If a battle breaks out I can only provide some support!
soso.string.5251: Here they come! Begin the ritual!
soso.string.5252: Where is this... my head hurts...
soso.string.5253: Can someone explain what’s going on...
soso.string.5255: I am the seventh Pontiff of the Holy‑Tree Church—Shishu... something seems wrong with my body.
soso.string.5256: Your life has already reached its end; the ritual is forcibly awakening you now.
soso.string.5257: This, too, is caused by the Sacred Tree’s aberration.
soso.string.5258: Some have abused the Sacred Tree’s power to create endless undead, and I strengthened the spell to forcibly awaken you.
soso.string.5259: To stop this, we need to reach the Holy‑Spirit Tree Altar... we need the gate’s key phrase.
soso.string.5260: My head’s still spinning; I wish there were more time to judge your words.
soso.string.5261: But it seems there’s little time, and...
soso.string.5262: I also have reason to trust you.
soso.string.5263: The key phrase for the gate is『□★▲◎▼■※』—don’t forget it.
soso.string.5264: Thank you for your trust, Pontiff.
soso.string.5265: Next... this spell doesn’t seem to stop on its own.
soso.string.5266: My reason is at its limit; the urge to destroy keeps growing.
soso.string.5267: Get ready... then strike me down.
soso.string.5268: It’s starting; I will grant you the Sacred Tree’s blessing.
soso.string.5269: I’ll withdraw for now; it’s on you to hold out!
soso.string.5271: Now all the curses have been lifted!
soso.string.5274: The ritual is about to begin—hang in there!
soso.string.5275: So this is how strong the berserk soldiers are...
soso.string.5277: Don’t worry... no matter how hard it is, he’ll do it.
soso.string.5278: What we must do now is defend this ritual site!
soso.string.5279: Keep the ritual from stopping, until
soso.string.5281: This is our battlefield; felling the enemies before us is our duty!
soso.string.5282: ..., fine! We’ll hold this place; as for subjugating the Erosion‑Dragon, we’ll rely on
soso.string.5284: Huff... huff... even with the ritual’s support... this many is too much!
soso.string.5289: Now I’ll raise the ritual’s output to the maximum and sweep away all the curses in one go!

soso.string.5488: 4. Ultimate Battle‑Technique — Cleave the Heavens and the Earth(24003)
soso.string.5489:
Deal 100× skill damage to the target.
Also inflict 30 seconds of Stun on the enemy.
soso.string.5491: For 10 seconds after finishing the charge, you are extremely Slowed and cannot enter running state.

soso.string.5508: Traits: High HP, single‑target damage, and a single‑target skill with a powerful armor‑break effect; the fastest choice for boss fights.

soso.string.6106: To use Secret Arts, you must first use spell‑sealing materials to craft a Secret‑Art Tome.
soso.string.6107: Then seal the Secret Art of the corresponding material into paper.
soso.string.6108: These materials can yield Secret Arts.
soso.string.6109: Then seal the recompense of the corresponding material into paper.
soso.string.6110: These materials can serve as recompenses.
soso.string.6111: Combine Secret Arts and recompenses into the book; at most eight in total can be slotted.
soso.string.6112: Secret Arts or recompenses of the same type stack both duration and potency.
soso.string.6113: A compiled Secret‑Art Tome can be dismantled back into notes and a blank book.
soso.string.6114: All things contain “principles.” For example, from the material 【Iron Ingot】 you can obtain concepts like 《iron‑made》、《sturdy》、《metal》....
soso.string.6115: Breaking a material down into its root “principles” and affixing them to a weapon is enchantment enhancement.
soso.string.6116: To extract a material’s “principles,” place the material in the center and surround it with one ring of extraction materials.
soso.string.6117: Each material consists of three primary “principles”; each extraction yields only one.
soso.string.6118: Scrolls of extracted “principles” come in two types, 《prefix》 and 《suffix》, which can be attached to weapons.
soso.string.6119: Scrolls of the same slot conflict; adding an enchantment to the same slot will overwrite the old one.
soso.string.6125: Inherit enhancements from the material weapon, preserving enchantments and infusions.
